and.name: Elevator
and.description: The firmware and simulation of an elevator to transport humans from certain floors to other floors.

and.name: Behavior
and.description: The behavior of the elevator in terms handling, ignoring, and prioritizing requests.

alt.name: Modes
alt.description: Modes indicate in which order incoming requests are handled.

feature.name: Sabbath
feature.description: The elevator from lowest to highest floor and vice versa. It opens the doors in every floor without any user input.

feature.name: FIFO
feature.description: The elevator proceeds requests based on the first-in-first-out principle. That is, the floor being requested first is the next target floor.

feature.name: ShortestPath
feature.description: The elevator always moves to the requested floor that is closest to the current floor.

feature.name: Service
feature.description: The service mode enables maintenance by heading towards the lowest floor and ignoring all requests unless the service mode is stopped from within the elevator.

or.name: Priorities
or.description: Priorities specify that certain requests are supposed to be processed faster than others.

feature.name: RushHour
feature.description: During rush hours the elevator moves to a particular floor if there are no requests. In the morning, it will move to the lowest floor and, in the afternoon, it will move to a floor in the center of the building.

feature.name: FloorPriority
feature.description: Certain floors as specified during initialization will always be handled before all remaining floors.

feature.name: PersonPriority
feature.description: With a special key, the request of certain persons are served first.

alt.name: CallButtons
alt.description: Call buttons enable to choose the desired floor in the inside as well as to call the elevator to a certain floor.

feature.name: DirectedCall
feature.description: On each floor, there are separate buttons to go upwards and downwards. The elevator is supposed to only open the doors if it is moving into the same direction as the call.

feature.name: UndirectedCall
feature.description: Each floor has just one button to request the elevator, but the direction cannot be indicated.

and.name: Security
and.description: Variability of the elevator that directly influences security.

or.name: Permission
or.description: Permissions enable to specify which floors can be reached by everyone or only with privileges.

feature.name: FloorPermission
feature.description: During initialization, certain floors can be deactivated and cannot be reached by the elevator.

feature.name: PermissionControl
feature.description: Permission control enables to reach non-public floors for those that are privileged.

and.name: Safety
and.description: Variability of the elevator that directly influences safety.

feature.name: Overloaded
feature.description: A sensor measures the load of the elevator and will not close the doors until the limit of the elevator is not reached.

rule.description: The elevator can only move if there are call buttons or the sabbath mode is chosen.
Call buttons for both directions are only useful when the elevator behaves differently depending on the pressed button.
Undirected call buttons are only supported for modes that can be influenced by those buttons.
